Memory management: interactive web authoring tool. bytecode is named "ActionScript Byte Code (.abc)"

Precompilation: 15k + 2850 per JIT arch + 500 per host OS

Memory management: Features are simplified, usually include assembler, compiler, text-level and binary-level interpreters, sometimes editor, debugger and OS. Compilation speeds are >20 SKLOC/S and behave much like JIT.
Precompilation: 2.8K to 5.6K; advanced, professional implementations are smaller.

Memory management: Is an open-source virtual machine designed for executing programs written in Hack and PHP.

Machine model: Java, Jython, Groovy, JRuby, C, C++, Clojure, Scala and several others
Memory management: Reference implementation by Sun ; OpenJDK: code under GPL ; IcedTea: code and tools under GPL
JIT: JDK, OpenJDK & IcedTea with regular JIT : Java, C, ASM ; IcedTea with the "Zero" JIT : Java, C
Precompilation: JVM is around 6500k lines; TCK is 80k tests and around 1000k lines

Machine model: C, C++, Objective-C, Ada, Fortran, and Rust
Memory management: MSIL, C and C++ output are supported. ActionScript Byte Code output is supported by Adobe Alchemy. bytecode is named "LLVM Bytecode (.bc)". assembly is named "LLVM Assembly Language (*.ll)".

Machine model: CLI languages including: C#, VB.NET, IronPython, IronRuby, and others

Memory management: UCSD Pascal, widespread in late 70s including Apple II

Machine model: Perl (6 & 5), NQP-rx, PIR, PASM, PBC, BASIC, bc, C, ECMAScript, Lisp, Lua, m4, Tcl, WMLScript, XML, and others

Memory management: Self-hosting implementation of Python, next generation of Psyco

Self hosting implementation of Squeak virtual machine.  Rich multi-media support.
